page.title: 01THE SLABS AND CAUSEWAY
page.content:
The{Slabs}and{Causeway}are public paths between Barrow and Quorn. Both are next to the{River Soar}because of this they are high off the ground. The slabs are so called because the path is made of concrete slabs. The ground around the slabs is rough grazing, so the{County Council}rent it out to farmers. Most of the trees growing around the path are horse chestnut and oak. The path used to follow the river but workmen who needed to go to Quorn every day built a path across the field which was then called{Scotch {Green.}The causeway starts at the river bridge and ends at the Lodge. The{Causeway}is made of pebble dash concrete, tarmac and ironwork.
{Ben Arrowsmith.
